title: Personal Assistant to the CEO Job at Arkounting Business Concepts Limited
content:
Arkounting Business Concepts - We are a brilliant and result-oriented team continuously seeking to offer world-class and simplified professional services and solutions (focused in Management Accounting, HR Consulting, Business Advisory etc.) to businesses across Africa. Our mission is to enhance business productivity by empowering and enabling them through our professional services.

We pride ourselves in providing a collaborative, and positive environment because it is important to us that you have a great experience through out your journey with us.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Personal Assistant to the CEO
Job Location: Ogudu, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Industry: Consulting (Arkounting Business Concepts Limited)

The Role


	This role is exciting, positively challenging and will provide growth to the prospective role holder.
	The ideal role holder is a proactive and detail-oriented Personal Assistant who is comfortable working in a fast-paced environment and supporting executive-level tasks.
	You will provide day-to-day administrative support to the CEO, including calendar management, communication handling, and project coordination.
	The role also involves helping to track deliverables, follow up on ongoing tasks, and ensure smooth execution of assigned projects.
	Most importantly, in line with our standard, he/she should be committed, hard-working and particular about delivering quality work.


Job Responsibilities


	Manage the CEO’s calendar, schedule meetings, and coordinate appointments.
	Organize travel arrangements, including flights, accommodation, and itineraries.
	Maintain filing systems, both electronic and physical.
	Assist in managing projects, tracking deadlines, and ensuring deliverables are met.
	Arkounting Business Concepts
	Handle sensitive information with the highest level of confidentiality and professionalism.
	Conduct research and prepare briefing materials, reports, or presentations as required
	Support additional administrative tasks and evolving priorities as the role develops.


Job Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess a BSc Degree with 2+ years of relevant experience as a Personal Assistant or in an administrative support role
	Excellent communication, time management, and organizational skills
	Strong attention to detail with the ability to multitask and prioritize effectively
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and Google Workspace
	Ability to conduct research and present findings clearly
	Discreet, trustworthy, and able to handle confidential information professionally
	A proactive, solution-oriented mindset
	Flexibility and willingness to take on varied tasks as needed
	A positive attitude and strong sense of ownership.


 

Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted. We sincerely appreciate your interest in being part of our team.

title: Supermarket Cashier Job at Domeo Resources International
content:
Domeo Resources International (DRI) is a prolific organisation which proffers HR and Management Consultancy solutions premised on excellence and innovation. DRI analyses various organisational problems, develops improvement plans, deploys those plans and monitors the plans to ensure improved organisational performance.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Supermarket Cashier

Job Location: Abuja (FCT) 
Reports to: The Supermarket Manager

Job Description
Main Function:
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The Supermarket Cashier is responsible for managing customer transactions efficiently, accurately, and courteously.
	The role requires handling point-of-sale operations, ensuring proper cash handling, and delivering a seamless checkout experience.
	The ideal candidate must be friendly, reliable, detail-oriented, and able to work in a fast-paced retail environment while maintaining a professional demeanor.


Role Responsibilities
Transaction Processing:


	Accurately scan, price, and register purchases using POS systems.
	Receive payments via cash, card, transfer, or vouchers and provide accurate change.
	Issue receipts and bag merchandise properly.
	Ensure the POS is balanced at the beginning and end of each shift.


Customer Service:


	Greet customers warmly and provide responsive and friendly service.
	Answer product-related questions or direct customers to appropriate store personnel.
	Resolve minor customer complaints or escalate to the supervisor when necessary.
	Assist elderly or disabled customers as needed.


Cash & Payment Reconciliation:


	Maintain an accurate cash drawer and follow proper cash-handling procedures.
	Perform end-of-day cash reconciliation and submit reports to the accounts or store manager.
	Immediately report any discrepancies, errors, or suspicious activities.


Store Presentation & Cleanliness:


	Maintain a clean and orderly checkout area.
	Monitor and refill shopping bags, receipt paper, and other supplies as needed.
	Report equipment malfunctions (POS, scanners, etc.) to the supervisor promptly.


Compliance:


	Follow internal policies regarding transaction limits, refund protocols, and price overrides.
	Comply with safety, hygiene, and sanitation standards.
	Adhere to attendance and punctuality standards.


Qualifications and Experience
Education and Certifications:


	Minimum of SSCE / WAEC; OND or higher qualification is an advantage.
	Minimum of 1 – 2 years of experience as a cashier, preferably in a retail or supermarket environment.
	Familiarity with POS systems, cash registers, and retail operations.
	Basic math and computer skills.
	Ability to work flexible hours, including weekends and public holidays.


Key Competencies:


	High level of integrity and accuracy
	Excellent customer service and communication skills
	Fast and efficient multitasking ability
	Professional appearance and behavior
	Team spirit and willingness to support other departments
	Good problem-solving and interpersonal skills


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their CV and Cover Letters to: recruitment@domeoresources.org using Supermarket Cashier as the subject of mai.

Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Personal Assistant / Social Media Manager
Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time (Hybrid - 2 days physically and 3 days remotely)

	We are seeking a highly organized and proactive Personal Assistant to support our client.

title: Internal Audit Officer Job at Vixa Pharmaceutical Company Limited
content:
Vixa Pharmaceutical Company Limited was founded by Chief Sir Ebuka Okafor, an entrepreneur with vast experience in the pharmaceutical industry. Vixa Pharmaceutical Company Limited has come of age with an imposing record of over 10 years meeting the needs of sick and needy through a range of globally sourced, best-in-their-class life saving medicines.

Our range of pharmaceutical products include critical care, super specialty products covering the categories of Anti-Malarial, Anti-Biotic, Anti-Fungal, Anti-Emetic, Steroid, NSAID drugs, Anti-Spasmodic, Anti-Hypertensive, Worm Expellant, Anti-Hastimine and Anti-Psychotic drugs.
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Internal Audit Officer
Job Location: Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	Reconciliation of stocks records using accepted accounting and statistical procedures.
	Conduct weekly, monthly, quarterly and annual review of audit report plans.
	Collect and analyze data to detect deficient controls, duplicated effort, extravagance, fraud, or non-compliance with laws, regulations, and management policies.


Responsibilities


	Verifying assets and liabilities by comparing items to documentation.
	Ensures compliance with established internal control procedures by examining records, reports, operating practices, and documentation.
	Completes audit work-papers by documenting audit tests and findings.
	Identify loopholes and recommend risk aversion measures and cost savings.
	Prepare and present reports that reflect audit’s results and document process.
	Review data about material assets, net worth, liabilities, capital stock, surplus, income, and expenditures.
	Communicates audit findings by preparing a final report; discussing findings with auditees.
	Examine inventory to verify journal and ledger entries.


Qualifications


	A minimum of HND / B.Sc. Degree Accounting, Finance, Business Administration or other related Social Sciences.
	Minimum of 2 years of experience in a reputable organization.
	Preferably Good Knowledge of Accounting Software i.e SAGE.
	Professional Qualification in Audit will be added advantage.


Requirements:


	Self-motivation
	Determination and confidence.
	A keen interest in the financial system
	Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, including good presentation and report writing skills.
	Advanced computer skills on MS Office, accounting software (SAGE) and databases.
	Meticulous attention to detail.
	Excellent problem-solving skills.
	Ability to work to deadlines, under pressure.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their CV and Cover Letter to: pharmarecruitment2online@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.
